div.l: By goddes saule it shall non othir be
This Iohn answerd Alyen auise the
The Meller is a ꝑperlous man he seide
And if he be out of his sleep̄ abreide
He miȝt don̄ vs bathe a vilanye
Aleyn answerd I counte him nat worth a flie
And vp he rist and by the wenche he crept
This wenche lay vpriȝt and fast slept
Til he so ny was or she miȝt spie
That it had ben to late for to crie
And shortly for to seyn they weren at oon̄
Now pley Aleyn for I will speke of Iohn
This Iohn lith stille a forlong wey or two
And to him self he makith routhe ⁊and woo
Allas qduod he this is a wickid iape
Now may I sey that I is but an ape
Yet hath my felaw somwhat for his harme
He hath the Millers douȝter in his arme
He auntred him he hath his nedes sped
And I ly as a draf sak in my bed
And whan this iape is told an othir day
I shal be holde a daffe a cokenay
I wil arise and auntre it be my feith
Vnhardy is vnsely thus men seith
And vp he rose and softly he went
Vnto the cradel and in his hand it hent
And bar it softe vnto his beddes fete
Sone aftir the wif her routing lete
And gan a wake and went her out to pisse
And come agein ⁊and gan her cradel misse
And groped here ⁊and there but she fond non̄
Allas qduod she I had almost mysgon̄
I had almost I goon̄ to the clerkes bed
Ey benedicite than had I foule sped
